column1: #Text=File photo of South Korean military troops .
#Text=On Tuesday , South Korea staged a huge military parade to mark its armed forces ' 65th anniversary in a display of long-range missiles considered a direct threat to North Korea .
#Text=11,000 troops and 190 different weapons systems were on display in the parade .
#Text=Wikinews interviewed several specialists about the parade 's possible significance .
#Text=Robert Kelly , Associate Professor of International Relations Pusan National University ( PNU ) in South Korea
#Text=Margaret Kosal , Assistant Professor at the Sam Nunn School of International Affairs at the Georgia Institute of Technology in Atlanta , Georgia
#Text=Gari Ledyard , Professor Emeritus of Korean Studies at Columbia University , New York
#Text=Sue Mi Terry , Senior Research Scholar at the Weatherhead East Asian Institute , Columbia University in New York
#Text=Young-hae Chi , Instructor in Korean at the University of Oxford , England
#Text=Seungkwon You , Associate Teaching Professor of Korean Studies at the University of Missouri
#Text=Image : Robert Kelly . ( Image missing from commons : image ; log )
#Text=( ( Wikinews ) ) What is your job role ?
#Text=I am a Professor of International Relations at PNU .
#Text=I am an Assistant Professor in the Sam Nunn School of International Affairs at the Georgia Institute of Technology , more commonly known as " Georgia Tech .
